Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Chorus 
    Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Russian State Academic People's Chorus Named after M. E. Pyatnichki now on a visit to the DPRK.
 It was conveyed to an official concerned by Aleksandra Permyakova, head and manager of the chorus.

articles.content:
Greetings to King of Thailand 
    Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Bhumibol Adulyadej, king of Thailand, on the occasion of his birthday and the national day.
 Extending warm congratulations to the king and the people of Thailand, the message sincerely wished him good health and happiness and the friendly people of Thailand progress and prosperity.

Warsaw Branch of Poland-Korea Association Formed
    Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the Warsaw Branch of the Poland-Korea Association took place on Nov. 26.
 Present there were Apoloniusz Golik, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the association, its general secretary and figures from various circles.
 The chairman of the branch elected at the ceremony expressed his resolution to conduct activities for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people in diverse forms and methods among political and public figures.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Extend Term of Presence of Troops in Iraq under Fire
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy Here
    Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- The human rights committees of the 4 religious orders of south Korea reportedly held a press conference in Seoul on Nov. 28 and denounced the police action of cracking down on the struggle of peasants for vital rights by force, causing a death.
 The secretary general of the Human Rights Committee of the National Council of Christian Churches of south Korea, the secretary general of the Human Rights Committee of Buddhists and other speakers said that the truth behind the incident should be probed and those responsible punished and that they would rally more religionists and do their best to probe the truth about the incident.    
 They demanded the resignation of the director of national police office and the leaderships of the ruling and opposition parties, apology and substantial measures for agriculture of the authorities, the ensuring of the vital rights of the people and abandonment of "neo-liberal" policy.
 A press release read at the press conference stressed that the authorities should stop attempting to cover up the murder case, probe the truth, apologize to the people and reexamine the "bill on rice negotiations".

DPRK Delegation Leaves for China
    Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Hydro-Meteorological Service of the DPRK headed by its director Ko Il Hun left here today for China.
 It was seen off at Pyongyang Railway Station by its Vice Director Ko Sang Bok and Gu Jinsheng, economic and commercial counselor of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Shop of Machine Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves to Attend Ministerial Meeting in China
    Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation led by Mun Ung Jo, vice-minister of Agriculture, left here today to participate in the ministerial meeting on coordination and cooperation in the efforts to prevent the spread of bird flu in Asia slated to be held in China.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kim Hyok Jin, vice-minister of Agriculture, officials concerned and Gu Jinsheng, Chinese economic and commercial councillor here.
